title: Representing SHM - position equation from graph

content.question: The graph represents the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for an object undergoing simple harmonic motion. Which of the following equations could represent the position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="x equals x sub 0 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction 3 pi t over 2 t sub 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals x sub 0 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 pi t over t sub 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals x sub 0 times the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction 3 pi t over 2 t sub 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x equals x sub 0 times the sine of, open parenthesis, the fraction 2 pi t over t sub 0, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
